intro: Senecio acutipinnus, commonly known as the sharp-pinnate groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and sharply pointed, giving it its common name, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Senecio acutipinnus is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive appearance.
